intro: Pilea silvicola, commonly known as the forest pilea, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a small shrub with dense, hairy leaves that help it retain moisture in its natural habitat. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Pilea silvicola is often found in shaded, humid environments such as forests and undergrowth.
